original: BERNER, Aron Pontus, Fabrikör, Borås, f Alingsås 11/10 83 av kvarnäg A Peterson o Nicoline Nilson, gm Berit Ahlberg. A.ås allm lärov. Anst kont, lager o fabr, sen åren re-pres å s :a o mell Sv, h Alingsås Bomullsvä-veri AB 98—14, repres i Sthlm o n :a Sv f Sthlms Bomullsspinneri & Väfveri AB 15—16, kont.ch Norrby Nya AB Borås 17—18. Ch o huv.deläg Berners AB Borås, blekeri, färg o appreturvk,, sed. 18, styr.led där. Resor: Tyskl, Schweiz, Tjeckoslov, Danm, Norge mfl. Hobbies: Arbete, böcker, resor.
translated: BERNER, Aron Pontus, Manufacturer, Borås, born in Alingsås on 11/10 1883, son of mill owner A Peterson and Nicoline Nilson, married to Berit Ahlberg. Attended general education at A.ås. Employed in office, warehouse, and factory, later became representative and president of several companies in Sweden, including Alingsås Cotton Mill AB from 1898 to 1914, representative in Stockholm and other Swedish cities for Stockholm Cotton Mill & Weaving AB from 1915 to 1916, and office manager at Norrby Nya AB Borås from 1917 to 1918. Owner and main partner of Berners AB Borås, a bleaching, dyeing, and finishing company since 1918, serving on the board of directors. Traveled to Germany, Switzerland, Czechoslovakia, Denmark, Norway, and others. Hobbies include work, books, and travel.

structured.name: Aron Pontus Berner
structured.description: Aron Pontus Berner was born on October 11, 1883, in Alingsås, Sweden. He was the son of A Peterson, a mill owner, and Nicoline Nilson. Aron Pontus Berner was married to Berit Ahlberg. He attended general education at A.ås. Throughout his career, he worked in various positions, starting in office, warehouse, and factory roles. In later years, he became a representative and president of several companies in Sweden. From 1898 to 1914, he served at Alingsås Cotton Mill AB. He also acted as a representative in Stockholm and other Swedish cities for Stockholm Cotton Mill & Weaving AB between 1915 and 1916. Additionally, he worked as the office manager at Norrby Nya AB Borås from 1917 to 1918. In 1918, Aron Pontus Berner became the owner and main partner of Berners AB Borås, a bleaching, dyeing, and finishing company. He also served on the board of directors. Aron Pontus Berner traveled extensively to countries such as Germany, Switzerland, Czechoslovakia, Denmark, and Norway. His hobbies included work, books, and travel.
